intro.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to access the Bioclipse-QSAR functionality from the Bioclipse Scripting Language.

item.title: Step 1: List available descriptors
item.description:
Descriptors in Bioclipse are identified with the Blue Obelisk Descriptor Ontology. To list available descriptors, use the command:
qsar.listDescriptors()

item.title: Step 2: Calculating single properties
item.description:
To calculate a single descriptor, use the following command:
qsar.calculate(IMolecule, descriptorID)
Example commands:
mol=cdk.fromSMILES("OC(COC=1C=CC=CC=1CC=C)CNC(C)C")
qsar.calculate(mol, "hBondDonors")

item.title: Step 3: Calculating multiple properties
item.description:
To calculate a list of descriptors for a list of molecules, use the following command:
qsar.calculate(molecules, descriptors)
The gist 95189 shows a script to demonstrate this. To run it; just save it as a JavaScript, e.g. as &qt;qsar-multi.js&qt;. Then open the file and run it.
